profile.biography: I am a problem solver and I enjoy development as a creative outlet to express my ideas.  I love spending time on little details and optimizing web apps. I am a team player and thrive in environments with opportunity for collaboration.

educations.title: University of Waterloo
educations.specification: Computer Science, Statistics, and Actuarial Science
educations.description: I originally majored in Actuarial Science but after taking some classes and doing an internship decided it wasn't for me. After taking my first Data Structures course I was hooked, and from there I made the jump to Statistics/Computer Science.  I particularly enjoyed the courses on Machine Learning, Algorithms, and Graphics

careers.title: Cadre
careers.description: Cadre is a startup which is creating an investment platform that connects individuals and institutions to real estate investment opportunities.  During my time at Cadre I picked up React/Redux to create their About page, and internal admin apps to record and notify investors about distribution events.  I also picked up some Nightwatch to increase E2E test coverage.

careers.title: Verdigris Technologies
careers.description: Verdigris specializes in energy monitoring, their device measures electrical consumption from circuit breakers and then use that data to detect devices running in the building, device malfunctions, and regulate device usage.  Here I created a pseudo-random scheduler to simulate electrical usage in a building, where the waiting times were deterministic or sampled from various distributions.  I also had the opportunity to do some research in breakpoint detection, and derived and implemented formulas for incremental statistics in Python.

careers.title: Pitney Bowes
careers.description: A company specializing in ecommerce and location intelligence.  Here I built a classifier to categorize regions in Connecticut to market or non-market areas.  I also worked on various scrapers to gather all filling locations for various brands.

careers.title: Centre for Education in Mathematics and Computing (CEMC)
careers.description: CEMC creates mathematics competitions and educational outreach for gradeschool and highschool students.  I was a lecturer for a weekly math enrichment program, and covered topics in linear programming and optimization.

projects.title: Pebbledoro
projects.description: App to aid in using the Pomodoro technique

projects.title: Ray Tracer
projects.description: Rendering scenes given objects and lightsource

projects.title: Sudoku Solver
projects.description: A puzzle solver using back tracking

projects.title: Blocks
projects.description: A puzzle game involving sticky blocks
